template.name: ElasticSearch
template.description:
Creator : Samih Gribi Template ElasticSearch (version 2.x max)
PRE-REQUISITE : Python2.7 installed on the server : Windows : https://www.python.org/ftp/python/2.7.13/python-2.7.13.amd64.msi Linux : yum install python2.7
installing pip : cd /tmp curl "https://bootstrap.pypa.io/get-pip.py" -o "get-pip.py" python2.7 get-pip.py
Install Modules :
pip install --upgrade setuptools pip install exec_cmd psutil elasticsearch2 re
Windows : Create Folder on Windows C:\Temp\ if not exist Linux : Will create logs on /tmp/
Set the macros : {$ES_HOST} => IP of ElasticSearch Cluster, default value is 127.0.0.1 {$ES_PORT} => Port of ElasticSearch API default is 9200 {$ES_PROCESS_NAME} => Name of ElasticSearch process name (elasticsearch-service-x64.exe or elasticsearch-service-x86.exe or elasticsearch) {$ES_STATUS} => 0 green, 1 yellow, 2 red

item.name: ElasticSearch Cluster Number of Active Primary Shards
item.description: Collect the number of Active Primary Shards

item.name: ElasticSearch Cluster Active Shards percent
item.description: Collect the Cluster Active Shards Percent as Number

item.name: Cluster ElasticSearch API availability
ElasticSearch Memory Used Percent
item.description: Collect the memory used in percent by the process elasticsearch

item.name: ElasticSearch Cluster Number of Data Nodes
item.description: Collect the number of data nodes

item.name: ElasticSearch Cluster Number of In Flight Fetch
item.description: Collect the number of Number of In Flight Fetch

item.name: ElasticSearch Cluster Number of Pending Tasks
item.description: Collect the number of Pending Tasks

item.name: ElasticSearch Process
item.description:
Check the availability of process elasticsearch-service-x86.exe or elasticsearch-service-x64.exe
return 0 if process is find return 1 if process is not find

item.name: ElasticSearch Status
item.description:
Check the status of the Cluster
Red = 2 Yellow = 1 Green = 0

item.name: ElasticSearch Cluster Task max waiting in queue ms
item.description: Collect the Task max waiting in queue ms

item.name: ElasticSearch Cluster Timed Out
item.description:
Collect if the cluster have a TimeOut
True = 1 False = 0

item.name: ElasticSearch Cluster Unassigned shards
item.description: Collect the number of unassigned shards

item.name: Collect information about ElasticSearch Services
item.description:
Discover services states, and send value to trapper items :
ES[es_availability] ES[service_state]

discovery_rule.name: Discover nodes
discovery_rule.description: Discover nodes stats and send value to trapper items :

trigger.name: Cluster ElasticSearch API is not available
ElasticSearch process not found
trigger.description:
Check the process exist : elasticsearch-service-x86.exe or elasticsearch-service-x64.exe
Verify if the service ElasticSearch is running on the server
return 0 if Available return 1 if Unavailable
Last Value : {ITEM.LASTVALUE}

trigger.name: ElasticSearch Status
